body:
## Priority
MEDIUM-HIGH

## Current Issue
Pool size is hardcoded to 2 (`src/engine/pool.ts:19`), which is insufficient for production deployments handling high concurrency.

## Proposed Implementation
```typescript
export interface PoolOptions {
  docker: Docker;
  poolSize?: number;  // Currently defaults to 2
  createOptions: Omit<Docker.ContainerCreateOptions, "Image">;
}
```

## Configuration
```json
{
  "pool": {
    "size": 10,  // Per-runtime pool size
    "maxTotal": 50,  // Total containers across all runtimes
    "idleTimeout": 300000  // Kill idle containers after 5min
  }
}
```

## Environment Variable
```bash
ISOL8_POOL_SIZE=10 isol8 serve --port 3000
```

## Benefits
- Support high-traffic production workloads
- Tune for specific hardware (more RAM = bigger pool)
- Different pool sizes for different runtimes
- Reduce cold starts in burst scenarios

## Metrics to Track
- Pool hit rate by runtime
- Average wait time for container
- Memory usage by pool size
- Cost vs performance tradeoff

## Related Issues
- Addresses #6 (race condition under burst load)
- Complements #8 (quotas and rate limiting)

## Recommendations
- Default: 2 (current)
- Development: 1-2
- Production (low traffic): 5
- Production (high traffic): 10-20
- Enterprise: 50+
title: [FEATURE] Configurable pool size
